intro: Ragala ulei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub, with stems that often root at the nodes. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and blue, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Ragala ulei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
